text:
Karnataka Silk Industries Corporation has organised an exhibition and sale of Mysore Silk products for four days from January 11. Mysore silk sarees, dress materials, shirts, and scarves are some of the products on display at the expo, which is on at Balija Naidu Sangam Trust, R.S. Puram, a press release said.

Graduation day

Degree certificates were distributed to 155 women workers of KPR Mill who had completed undergraduate and post-graduate courses.

According to a release, the mill has “Learn While You Earn” programme and women workers can continue school or college education after their work hours. So far, 13,000 workers have benefited from the programme. At the graduation ceremony, Chandrakantha Jayabalan, Vice-Chancellor of Tamil Nadu Open University, distributed the certificates.
